thread.title: Hero dog sniffs out litter of abandoned puppies during woodland walk
thread.title_full: Hero dog sniffs out litter of abandoned puppies during woodland walk

author: Helena Horton
title: Hero dog sniffs out litter of abandoned puppies during woodland walk

organizations.name: holly hedge animal sanctuary helena horton

text:
Hero dog sniffs out litter of abandoned puppies during woodland walk These three little puppies were left for dead in a bin Credit: Holly Hedge Animal Sanctuary Helena Horton 13 January 2017 â€¢ 10:53am 
A heroic dog has sniffed out a litter of abandoned Border Collie puppies while on a walk in the woods. 
The puppies are now all happy and healthy, and are likely to find loving homes. 
Their lives were in jeopardy when they were dumped in a plastic recycling bin in Failand Woods in Bristol. 
Holly Hedge Animal Sanctuary referred to the rescue as a "lassie style moment", as the heroic dog who sniffed them out alerted her owner. This puppy was left for dead on a cold winter's night Credit: Holly Hedge Animal Sanctuary 
T he dog's owner then dropped off the three puppies at the sanctuary. 
The animal sanctuary wrote on Facebook: "Luckily a dog out walking sniffed them out, and in a true 'lassie style' moment, alerted her owner to rescue them, thank goodness as we truly feel they wouldn't have survived a cold winters night". 
"There is no excuse for leaving puppies in this manner. They were not secure in the box and could have easily have been killed." 
The puppies have all been taken to the vet and were in good health, except for needing a de-worming. Watch | Adorable puppies react to seeing snow for first time 00:31 
T he sanctuary continued: "Anyone interested should call in to the sanctuary and fill in an application form, due to the high demand for rescue pups we will select the most suitable homes to meet them. 
"Ideally potential owners should be home most of the time and possibly have some knowledge of active dogs such as collies/labs etc but in the meantime, how cute are they!" 
They have been named Tosca, Mabel, and Carlos and are being fostered while they await families to adopt them permanently. 
If people want to help out the animals at the sanctuary, Holly Hedge has an Amazon wishlist, so kind-hearted donors can choose which gift they want to give the puppies.
